paragraph.htmltext: When the batteries are packed for storage, they need to be separated to avoid short circuit and propagation of a thermal runaway during storage.
When scrap batteries are packed to place in storage, a good measure is to pack and to handle them as new ones.
For damaged batteries a good practices is to cover them with sand.
For sorted rechargeable waste batteries a good practice is to store them in metal drums of 210m with liner and add after every 10cm a layer of vermiculites.
Measures should be taken to avoid hotspots. These hotspot can lead to a primary fire which possible initiated a thermal reactions in the battery leading to a thermal runaway.
